meanings.definition: To remove or make invisible by blotting or wiping.
meanings.sent1: She was blotting the spilled juice from the table.
meanings.sent2: I always blot the excess oil from my pizza with a napkin.
meanings.sent3: The cat was blotting its paw prints from the muddy floor.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were like raindrops blotting the paper of her diary.
meanings.sent5: The eraser was blotting out the mistake on the test paper.

meanings.definition: A spot or stain, especially of ink.
meanings.sent1: There was a blotting of ink on the corner of the page.
meanings.sent2: The blotting on his shirt revealed he had been working with a pen.
meanings.sent3: The blotting on the carpet looked like a tiny island on a map.
meanings.sent4: The blotting on the canvas added character to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The blotting on the document made it difficult to read the words underneath.
